item.title: A bill to make a technical correction relating to the land conveyance authorized by Public Law 108-67.

latestAction.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on Public Lands and Forests. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 109-104.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. (text of measure as introduced: CR S4160)

summary.text:
Makes a technical correction relating to the description of the conveyance authorized by Public Law 108-67 (a law providing for the conveyance of certain land in the Lake Tahoe Basin Management Unit to the Washoe Indian Tribe of Nevada and California).

Permits any approved general public access (through existing easements or by boat) to or use of land remaining within the Lake Tahoe Basin Management Unit after the conveyance, including access to and use of the beach and shoreline areas adjacent to the portion of land conveyed.

bill.title: A bill to amend Public Law 108-67 to correct a provision relating to the conveyance of the Lake Tahoe Basin Management Unit.

item.title: A bill to amend Public Law 108-67 to correct a provision relating to the conveyance of the Lake Tahoe Basin Management Unit.
A bill to amend Public Law 108-67 to correct a provision relating to the conveyance of the Lake Tahoe Basin Management Unit.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. (text of measure as introduced: CR S4160)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
